history.content:
Hello! If you are interested in Robotics, our faculty have put together some suggested courses that you may wish to take. They can be found here: http://www.eecs.berkeley.edu/Programs/Notes/sample-curricula-EE.pdf

I hope this is helpful.

Sarah

children.subject: If you're on facebook, I think you'll have better luck getting course advice here: https://www.facebook.com/groups/631097886985088/

Hi, sorry for the delay in answering, I needed to follow up with the instructor for EE 106 A (previously EE C 125).  Here's what Professor Bacjsy says:

"I expect a good knowledge of matrix mathematics,i.e linear algebra. Beyond that we assume that the students have good understanding of newton mechanics, position,velocity,acceleration, mass, forces. Calculus is assumed, derivatives an d integral calculus.The rest is an application of these concepts into more complex robotic systems which I teach. We also expect that students know a bit signal processing, such as Fourier Transform,Taylor approximation."

I hope that helps you make your decision.  In addition, I consulted with Professor Abbeel (more on the CS side of robotics) who said: "I don't think the student has taken the wrong classes for more modern AI oriented robotics."

If you have more detailed questions along the lines of upper-division courses in Robotics I recommend you reach out Professor Bacjsy direclty.  You'll also be able to get good advice for next semester if you choose her or another Robotics professor for faculty advising.  Good luck!

Susanne

Thanks a lot, Susanne! This answer definitely help. And yes, my interest is actually leaning more toward the intelligent system rather than the mechanic side of robotics, so Prof Abbeel's statement really consoles me :)

Hi Sarah. Thanks for the info. That's actually the guide I use to schedule my next 2 semester classes.

I am still concerned with taking those 3 classes in one semester, hope anybody can answer this

history.content:
I am a transfer student in my senior year and thus I am a little bit behind in term of number of classes I have taken compared to freshmen. I am interested in Robotic/Control.

I think I have been taking the wrong classes. Upper divs I took : CS170, CS188

My plan for next semester is: EE120, EE149, EE106A (previously EE C125)

I know that 120 is relatively easy, 149 is project/lab heavy, but I don't have a clue for robotics (EE106A)? How hard it is? Am I okay taking those 3 classes?

And I think in my last semester(Spring 2016) I am going to take EE192, EE105, EE C128.

EE149 and EE106 are only offered in fall, while EE192 is only offered in Spring.

Other classes that are related are CS189 and EE123, but I don't think I am able to take all of those classes. And given I have taken 2 upper div classes, I actually don't need to take that many classes to graduate (3 more upper divs).

How is my plan, please let me know any info on any of these classes and whether I have made the right decision. Thanks!
history.subject: Robotic/Control Focus. How hard is EE C125? What classes should I take?
